bibl.note: This document is a letter dated January 7, 1849 from James Miller to Robert A. Burford. The letter is a complaint against Buford for misrepresenting the physical status of two slaves he sold to Miller. The two slaves were said to be sound and healthy; however it was later discovered that one had an eye out and the other suffered from Phthisic.

opener.salute: Mr Robt Mister Robert A Burford

div.p: I was verry very much surprised a few days since to learn for the first time that two of the negroes are unsound and that you knew it when you sold them to me towit Daniel has an eye out and Mary has Phthisic both of whom you represented and warranted sound in your bill of sale, You will recollect & so will others that you stated repeatedly to me that they were all sound healthy negroes no blemishes & I shall Certainly claim (& hereby notify you of it) a reduction out of the amount of promised you for these negroes let me hear from you upon this Subject
